text:
Hey Canton team, a little update!

So I have been cooking a very simple demo application, where a User can:
• create Account contract(s)
• Mint & Burn Holdings through those Account contracts
This demo is running in a docker compose against a dockerized canton sandbox. I generated TS bindings for the V2 API using an openapi codegen library. Does not use any @daml npm libraries, as they proved to be outdated.
Hoping to deploy to DevNet/TestNet, although as you can see in <https://dlc-ag42820.slack.com/archives/C081VS8N76Z/p1746096516677359>, there are some challenges with _downgrading it_ to the current Devnet versions. We are on the cutting edge as always :innocent:

The goal of the exercise is to prove out the whole stack! API integration from our services, DAR distribution, etc. Also, the dockerized canton node will be used in our automated tests to develop the rust code against.

So next up is to iterate our way up with the real contracts & authentication & rust connector.

elements.text:
Hey Canton team, a little update!

So I have been cooking a very simple demo application, where a User can:
create Account contract(s)
Mint & Burn Holdings through those Account contracts

This demo is running in a docker compose against a dockerized canton sandbox. I generated TS bindings for the V2 API using an openapi codegen library. Does not use any @daml npm libraries, as they proved to be outdated.
Hoping to deploy to DevNet/TestNet, although as you can see in
, there are some challenges with
downgrading it
to the current Devnet versions. We are on the cutting edge as always

The goal of the exercise is to prove out the whole stack! API integration from our services, DAR distribution, etc. Also, the dockerized canton node will be used in our automated tests to develop the rust code against.

So next up is to iterate our way up with the real contracts & authentication & rust connector.
